terms.definition: A centralized software system that enables organizations to create, manage, store, and collaborate on technical documents and knowledge resources.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents over time, ensuring teams always work with the most current version and can revert to previous versions if needed.
Technology that uses artificial intelligence to automate tasks, provide intelligent insights, and enhance user experience through machine learning capabilities.
A single, unified location where all documents, files, and data are stored and organized, providing easy access and management for all users.
The process of multiple departments or teams working together on shared documents and projects through integrated communication and workflow tools.
The coordination and automation of business processes, including task assignments, approvals, and document routing to improve efficiency.
A software system hosted on remote servers and accessed via the internet, allowing users to work from anywhere with real-time synchronization.
Documents that are properly organized, tracked, and maintained to meet compliance standards and regulatory inspection requirements.
Immediate synchronization of changes across all users and systems, ensuring everyone has access to the most current information instantly.
The ability to monitor document status, changes, and user interactions throughout the document lifecycle for accountability and compliance.
Pre-configured processes that automatically route documents, assign tasks, and trigger actions based on predefined rules and conditions.
Software as a Service - a cloud computing model where software applications are delivered over the internet on a subscription basis.
Isolated information systems where data is stored separately and cannot be easily accessed or shared across different departments or applications.
Structured processes that automatically route documents through designated reviewers and decision-makers for authorization before publication or implementation.
The process of searching for and accessing specific documents or information from a documentation system, often enhanced by search and categorization features.
